title: Lo que oía a través de la pared
titleTranslation: What I heard through the wall

thumbnail.generation_prompt: Person in a room with ear close to a wall, listening, apartment interior.

tags.name: Grammar
tags.description: Subjunctive (dudar, para que, lo que), relative clauses, complex past narrative, conditional nuance

tags.name: Vocabulary
tags.description: Apartment life, sounds, emotions, social interaction, embarrassment and relief

tags.name: Themes
tags.description: Misunderstanding, paranoia, neighbor relations, funny twist, everyday suspense

content.text: Vivo en un piso con paredes tan finas que oigo casi todo lo que ocurre al otro lado.
content.translation: I live in a flat with walls so thin that I hear almost everything that happens on the other side.
detailedTranslation: tan finas que — so thin that
lo que ocurre — what happens (relative)

content.text: Una noche empecé a oír gritos y algo que sonaba a cristales rotos.
content.translation: One night I started to hear shouts and something that sounded like broken glass.
detailedTranslation: sonaba a — sounded like
cristales rotos — broken glass

content.text: Luego, silencio absoluto.
content.translation: Then, absolute silence.

content.text: Me quedé despierto preguntándome si debía hacer algo o si me estaría imaginando cosas.
content.translation: I stayed awake wondering whether I ought to do something or whether I was imagining things.
detailedTranslation: preguntándome — wondering (gerund); preguntarse
debía — I ought to; deber, imperfect

content.text: Al día siguiente volvió a ocurrir: voces alteradas, un golpe sordo y de nuevo ese silencio inquietante.
content.translation: The next day it happened again: raised voices, a dull thud, and again that unsettling silence.
detailedTranslation: volvió a ocurrir — it happened again
alteradas — agitated, raised
golpe sordo — dull thud

content.text: No conocía al vecino más que para cruzarnos en el rellano.
content.translation: I didn't know the neighbor except for passing each other on the landing.
detailedTranslation: más que para — only to (no más que = nothing more than)
rellano — landing (of stairs)

content.text: Empecé a imaginarme lo peor: una discusión que se había ido de las manos, algo peor.
content.translation: I started to imagine the worst: an argument that had got out of hand, something worse.
detailedTranslation: se había ido de las manos — had got out of hand; irse de las manos

highlights.text: se había ido de las manos

content.generation_prompt: Person at home with ear close to the wall, listening, worried expression, apartment interior.

content.text: Pasaron tres días así; ya no lograba concentrarme en el trabajo.
content.translation: Three days went by like that; I could no longer manage to concentrate on work.
detailedTranslation: lograba — I managed to; lograr, imperfect
concentrarme — to concentrate; reflexive

content.text: Me sentía culpable por no actuar, pero también tenía miedo de entrometerme.
content.translation: I felt guilty for not acting, but I was also afraid of sticking my nose in.
detailedTranslation: entrometerme — to interfere, stick my nose in; reflexive

content.text: No sabía si llamar a la policía o si sería exagerado.
content.translation: I didn't know whether to call the police or whether that would be overkill.
detailedTranslation: sería — would be; conditional of ser
exagerado — exaggerated, overkill

content.text: Al final decidí que al menos llamaría al timbre para comprobar que todo estuviera bien.
content.translation: In the end I decided that at least I would ring the doorbell to check that everything was okay.
detailedTranslation: comprobar que + subjunctive — to check that (something is the case)
estuviera — was; imperfect subjunctive of estar

content.text: Bajé los escaleros con el corazón en un puño.
content.translation: I went down the stairs with my heart in my mouth.
detailedTranslation: con el corazón en un puño — idiom: with one's heart in one's mouth

content.generation_prompt: Person standing in front of a neighbor's door in an apartment corridor, about to ring the doorbell, tense posture.

content.text: Llamé al timbre; nadie respondió al principio.
content.translation: I rang the doorbell; no one answered at first.

content.text: Estaba a punto de irme cuando se abrió la puerta.
content.translation: I was about to leave when the door opened.
detailedTranslation: Estaba a punto de — I was about to
cuando — when

content.text: El vecino apareció con una expresión entre sorprendida y molesta.
content.translation: The neighbor appeared with an expression somewhere between surprised and annoyed.
detailedTranslation: entre... y — between... and (figurative)

content.text: Le expliqué que había oído ruidos y que quería asegurarme de que no pasara nada grave.
content.translation: I explained that I had heard noises and that I wanted to make sure nothing serious was going on.
detailedTranslation: asegurarme de que + subjunctive — to make sure that
pasara — was happening; subjunctive

content.text: Él frunció el ceño y luego se echó a reír.
content.translation: He frowned and then burst out laughing.
detailedTranslation: frunció el ceño — he frowned
echarse a reír — to burst out laughing

content.text: Me hizo pasar; en el salón, la televisión estaba a todo volumen.
content.translation: He invited me in; in the living room, the TV was at full blast.
detailedTranslation: hacer pasar — to show in, invite in
a todo volumen — at full volume

content.generation_prompt: Living room with television on, neighbor gesturing toward the TV, another person looking embarrassed or relieved, apartment interior.

content.text: Era un partido de fútbol: los comentaristas gritaban, la afición rugía y alguien acababa de marcar.
content.translation: It was a football match: the commentators were shouting, the crowd was roaring, and someone had just scored.
detailedTranslation: afición — (here) the crowd, fans
rugía — was roaring; rugir, imperfect
acababa de marcar — had just scored; acabar de + infinitive

content.text: Me pidió disculpas por el volumen y confesó que no se había dado cuenta de lo que se oía al otro lado.
content.translation: He apologized for the volume and admitted that he hadn't realised what could be heard on the other side.
detailedTranslation: pedir disculpas — to apologise
darse cuenta de — to realise
lo que se oía — what could be heard (passive-like)

content.text: Salí de allí sintiéndome a la vez aliviado y ridículo.
content.translation: I left feeling both relieved and ridiculous.
detailedTranslation: a la vez — at the same time, both
sintiéndome — feeling (gerund); sentirse

content.text: Desde entonces, cuando oigo gritos a través de la pared, me limito a recordar que el fútbol existe.
content.translation: Since then, when I hear shouts through the wall, I just remind myself that football exists.
detailedTranslation: me limito a — I just (do something); limitarse a + infinitive

pared fina.explanation: Paredes finas = thin walls (you hear the neighbours).

lo que ocurre.explanation: Relative clause: lo que + verb = what (the thing that).

sonar a.explanation: Sonar a + noun: sonaba a cristales = sounded like glass.

volver a.explanation: Volver a + infinitive: volvió a ocurrir = it happened again.

rellano.explanation: The flat area between flights of stairs; en el rellano = on the landing.

irse de las manos.explanation: Idiom; una discusión que se fue de las manos = an argument that got out of hand.

lograr.explanation: Lograr + infinitive; no lograba concentrarme = I couldn't concentrate.

entrometerse.translation: to interfere, stick one's nose in
entrometerse.explanation: Reflexive; tener miedo de entrometerme = afraid of interfering.

exagerado.explanation: Sería exagerado = it would be overkill.

comprobar.explanation: Comprobar que + subjunctive = to check that (something is so).

estar bien.explanation: Todo estuviera bien = that everything was okay (subjunctive after comprobar que).

corazón en un puño.explanation: Idiom: con el corazón en un puño = with one's heart in one's mouth.

estar a punto de.explanation: Estar a punto de + infinitive: estaba a punto de irme = I was about to leave.

entre.explanation: Entre sorprendida y molesta = somewhere between surprised and annoyed.

asegurarse.explanation: Asegurarse de que + subjunctive = to make sure that.

no pasar nada.explanation: No pasara nada grave = that nothing serious was going on.

echarse a reír.explanation: Echarse a + infinitive = to start (doing something) suddenly.

hacer pasar.explanation: Me hizo pasar = he invited me in / showed me in.

a todo volumen.explanation: Estar a todo volumen = to be at full blast.

afición.explanation: Here: la afición (football fans); can also mean hobby.

acabar de.explanation: Acabar de + infinitive: acababa de marcar = had just scored.

pedir disculpas.explanation: Pedir disculpas por algo = to apologise for something.

darse cuenta.explanation: No se había dado cuenta = he hadn't realised.

a la vez.explanation: A la vez aliviado y ridículo = both relieved and ridiculous.

limitarse a.explanation: Limitarse a + infinitive: me limito a recordar = I just remind myself.
